metadata.dc:description: We present the case of a 23-year-old man with fever of unknown origin, who developed acute liver failure 2 months after symptom onset, requiring an urgent liver transplantation. The diagnosis of adult-onset Still's disease was established after the reappearance of symptoms after transplantation, and high doses of corticosteroids were used to control disease activity. Subsequently, given the impossibility of tapering the steroid dose, interleukin-1 receptor blocking treatment was started with satisfactory outcome. We also review the published literature.
metadata.dc:title: Enfermedad de Still del adulto con desarrollo de insuficiencia hepática que precisa trasplante hepático.
[Adult-onset Still's disease with liver failure requiring liver transplantation].
